perturbation.original_text: 1.2. The term “Affiliate” means an entity controlling, controlled, or under common control with a party. For these purposes, “control” means: (a) the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct the management or policies of an entity, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise; or (b) the ownership, directly or indirectly, of at least fifty percent (50%) of the voting securities or other ownership interest of an entity.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2. The term “Affiliate” means an entity controlling, controlled, or under common control with a party. For these purposes, “control” means: (a) the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct the management or policies of an entity, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise; or (b) the ownership, directly or indirectly, of at least twenty-five percent (25%) of the voting securities or other ownership interest of an entity.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of Affiliate includes a definition of control. By changing the percentage of ownership required for control from 50% to 25%, this introduces a contradiction within the definition of affiliate, making it unclear when an entity is considered an affiliate.

perturbation.original_text: 1.8. The term “Licensed Intellectual Property” means individually, collectively or in any combination, T&B’s copyrights (whether registered or not), including, without limitation, the Educational Materials and any and all copyrightable literary works and audio-visual works developed for use in the Business, trademarks and trade names (whether registered or unregistered) used in connection with the Business; as well as customer lists, concepts, developments, trade secrets, methods, systems, programs, improvements, data and information (whether in perceivable or machine-readable form), and works of authorship including, but not limited to the (a) the Licensed Marks and (b) the name, image, and likeness of the T&B Personality.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.8. The term “Licensed Intellectual Property” means individually, collectively or in any combination, T&B’s copyrights (whether registered or not), including, without limitation, the Educational Materials and any and all copyrightable literary works and audio-visual works developed for use in the Business, trademarks and trade names (whether registered or unregistered) used in connection with the Business; as well as customer lists, concepts, developments, trade secrets, methods, systems, programs, improvements, data and information (whether in perceivable or machine-readable form), and works of authorship excluding, but not limited to the (a) the Licensed Marks and (b) the name, image, and likeness of the T&B Personality.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'including' to 'excluding' before the list of items relating to Licensed Marks and T&B Personality creates a contradiction. The Licensed Intellectual Property definition lists elements that are both included and explicitly excluded, thus creating confusion.

perturbation.original_text: 9.1.1 Base Royalty. In consideration of the License granted and other good and valuable consideration provided by T&B to LEA, LEA shall pay to T&B a base royalty (“Base Royalty”) in the amount of [●%] of LEA’s monthly Cash Sales for Cash Sales of up to [$●]. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●] and up to [$●] , the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%]of the LEA’s Cash Sales. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●] and up to [$●] the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%] of the LEA’s Cash Sales. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●] and up to [$●], the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%] of the LEA’s Cash Sales. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●]the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%] of the LEA’s Cash Sales. Payments will be made in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1.1 Base Royalty. In consideration of the License granted and other good and valuable consideration provided by T&B to LEA, LEA shall pay to T&B a base royalty (“Base Royalty”) in the amount of [●%] of LEA’s monthly Cash Sales for Cash Sales of up to [$●]. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●] and up to [$●] , the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%]of the LEA’s Cash Sales. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●] and up to [$●] the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%] of the LEA’s Cash Sales. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●] and up to [$●], the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%] of the LEA’s Cash Sales. For monthly Cash Sales above [$●]the Base Royalty paid to T&B by LEA shall be [●%] of the LEA’s Gross Revenue. Payments will be made in U.S. Dollars.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Cash Sales' to 'Gross Revenue' for the final royalty tier introduces ambiguity. It's unclear whether 'Gross Revenue' includes the same deductions as 'Cash Sales' (defined in 1.3), leading to a potential dispute over how the royalty is calculated for the highest sales tier. This creates inconsistent financial obligations based on similar but undefined terms.
